name: Black Monday Arrives!
description: Black Monday has arrived, like a train hitting a solid object. Suddenly our exports to Europe declined dramatically, and we will have to take action to rectify this.

name: Bypass Singapur
description: In recent years, more and more goods directed toward Mitteleuropa are shipped through Singapur rather than Batavia, but we control our side of the strait of Malacca as well, we owe nothing in these taxes to Germany and can easily resupply in our own ports.

name: Expand the Batavia Dockyards
description: The Batavia Dockyards are well-known for the old wooden ships docked there which sail throughout the Indies to transport goods and people. We should expand it to handle more modern ships in greater numbers as well.

name: Expand KPM
description: The Royal Packet Navigation Company (Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij) has been maintaining inter-island shippinglines since 1888, and already bypassed Singapur. By helping them expand we will increase inter-island commerce as well as our amount of draftable ships.

name: Fight Piracy in the Malacca Strait
description: Piracy in the Malacca Strait has been infamous since a very long time for its ferocity. We should once more outfit convoys and expeditions to pacify this lawless strait.

name: Limit Rice Imports
description: Black Monday has caused the international prices for rice to plunge, making it hard for our subjects to make a living off their rice farm. We should limit the import of rice to force the price to go up again, so that we don't wind up with a famine when the prices start to rise again.

name: A Selfsustainable Foodsystem
description: By investing extra in the efficiency of rice farming, we can get rid of our dependence on other parts of Asia for rice to feed the colonial masses, which will make us in turn stronger.

name: Agrarian Relief
description: By helping farmers with support, we can limit the suffering caused by Black Monday, making our rule more secure.

name: Purchase Sugar Fields
description: With the arrival of Black Monday, one of the largest export goods of the Dutch East Indies, sugar, became a luxury item that no one in Europe would buy anymore. Those who invested in plots of land to build sugar suffer, often having incurred debts to buy their plot. By buying sugar-farming land, the colonial government can obtain land that could be used for the establishment of colonial industry.

name: Colonial Industry
description: With the new free plots of land, we can establish colonial industry to increase our production and to bring prosperity to the archipelago and work to the Dutch overseeers.

name: Step Up Rubber Production
description: With Black Monday, rubber was hit hard by the lower prices, perhaps no longer being the precious commodity it once was. To make up for the lower prices, we should expand the production to export greater amounts.

name: Expand Shell Operations
description: The Bataafse Petroleum Maatschappij controls all oil rigs in the Indies. By helping them expand, we can increase the oil production to make up for lower prices as Black Monday greatly lowered the petroleum demands.

name: Expand Infrastructure
description: By expanding the infrastructure of Java, we can more easily transport goods and people, increasing our national efficiency.

name: Precrisis Levels Reattained
description: Thanks to our actions, we have managed to return to the levels before the Black Monday crash. In some sectors, we've even surpassed all previous production levels.

name: Industrialising the East Indies
description: With our economy secure, we can start focusing on expanding our colonial industry towards amounts not seen before in the archipelago.

name: Focus on Civilian Industry
description: By expanding the civilian industry in the colony, we can decrease building times and increase our general production.

name: Focus on Arms Industry
description: The Indies is home to the Artillerie Constructie Winkel, an arms company reaching back to the times of the VOC. By working with them, we can expand our arms industry.

name: A Modern Economy!
description: With our recent industrialisation, our economy has become significantly more modern: a few years ago, most of the Indies economy was almost completely agrarian in nature, and now we have several industrial facilities. There is still a long way to go however.

name: Review the KNIL
description: The KNIL has remained largely the same since the weltkrieg. Perhaps a review could be positive towards their performance.

name: Army of all East Indians
description: So far, we've not accepted any Inlanders in meaningful numbers into our ranks, but the archipelago is large, and the threats to it many, and our 'white' KNIL is overstretched. Perhaps we should consider changing this policy.

name: Selfsufficient Defence Force
description: By taking in locals who are willing to work with us, our defence can become selfsufficient, with no risk of us becoming vulnerable in the unfortunate event that, for instance, the mainland Netherlands would be occupied by a foreign power.

name: Army of Totoks
description: Letting in Inlanders in our ranks would only degrade our superior morale and proud tradition. The KNIL has held its ground for long enough and with extensive conscription amongst the Europeans in the colony, we can surely keep the colony safe until reinforcements shall arrive.

name: Planning for an Emergency
description: If there is an emergency, we may not be able to keep the situation in check forever, but we can surely stall any invasion long enough for conscripted reinforcement from the homeland to arrive.

name: Doctrinal Effort
description: We should pick a doctrine to follow, lest we lag behind compared to those wishing to see us harm in doctrinal matters.

name: Jungle Training
description: Much of the Dutch East Indies is made up of jungle. We should focus on training in these harsh conditions, to allow us to fight more efficiently in those conditions.

name: Royal Dutch East Indian Marines
description: By establishing a Marine Corps specific to the Dutch East Indies, which is made up of local forces specialized in landings, a not-unimportant part of warfare in this insular region.

name: Modern Guns
description: We should invest in better equipment for our soldiers, not in the least in better guns to aid the defence of our country.

name: Defending the Indies
description: The Indies are the jewel of the Dutch empire. We shall defend it with all we have. no one shall take it!

name: Fortifying Java
description: Java is the political heart of the Indies. By fortifying it, we can make any foreign invasion at the very least highly costly in terms of men and equipment for the enemy.

name: Military Aviation of the KNIL
description: The Military Aviation of the KNIL acts as the air force of the colony. While we currently have a few planes already, it seems the war of the future shall be fought in the air, and we can not allow our enemies to take the upper hand there.

name: Request Extra Investments
description: By requesting the government to do extra investments in our local air force, we can both maintain and expand this military branch to become competitive with the rest of the world.

name: East Indian Bombers
description: Bombers can cripple enemy industry as well as support our land-based operations. By investing heavily in them, we shall make our air force more complete.

name: East Indian Fighters
description: Bombers can do nothing if enemy fighters pull them out the air; we should invest in fighters to ensure the security of our airspace and to prevent enemy bombers from operating above our lands.

name: Expand the Airfields
description: The Indies are far and wide. By expanding the airfields, we can not only serve a military purpose, but also increase the capacity of civilian airfields allowed goods, people and information to travel faster between the islands.

name: Fokker Investments
description: Fokker is Europe's largest plane producer and has strong ties to the Netherlands. By granting them advantages in regulation or tax we might be able to tempt them into investing here, perhaps as their first time branching out to Asia.

name: KNIL Parachutistenkorps
description: By setting up a parachutists corps specific to the Indies, we can combine the abilities of the KNIL and its air force to allow us to act swiftly in case of an emergency by dropping parachutists above it.

name: Expand the Government Navy
description: The Government Navy is officially not part of the KNIL and thus our jurisdiction, but its location and its location here does make us the de-facto overseeing instance. We should invest in expanding it, right here!

name: Local Dockyards
description: By producing dockyards right here, we can build some ships separate from the Netherlands, allowing us a bit more freedom to produce new ships within our budget.

name: Focus on Submarines
description: In an open battle against the Japanese, it seems impossible to beat their navy. Instead we should focus on our own advantages: the Netherlands maintains some of the most sophisticated submarines, an unique advantage that could win us an advantage in the naval battle.

name: Helfrich's Naval Guerilla
description: Our admiral Helfrich has devised a 'guerilla' plan, using submarines to attack and then disengage, to wear out any enemy naval superiority as if it was a guerilla war on land.

name: Focus on Light Cruisers
description: We should focus on light cruisers as strong ships that can safeguard our larger capital ships while still maintaining enough firepower to deter our enemies.

name: Fleet in Being
description: By maintaining our fleet in being, we shall eventually defeat the enemy; we would not have gotten here if our proud naval tradition would've been a farce!

name: Focus on Destroyers
description: Destroyers are ideal to fight off enemy submarines and thus as screening vessels. Investing in them might be a sound idea.

name: Invest in Extra Capital Ships
description: With screening vessels alone we will not be able to challenge any foreign navy. We need several capital ships with big guns to penetrate the armor on their side.

name: Naval Bombers
description: By combining our knowledge on aerial and naval warfare, we can build splendid naval bombers that could turn any naval battle the other way around.

name: Bonifacius de Jonge Resigns
description: Governor-General De Jonge has held office now since 1931, and had announced in advance that he would retire from it for a while. Time to invite our new governor-general to the palace in Batavia.

name: Palar
description: Nico Palar is a senior member of the SDAP party and would be the first native governor-general of the colonies. We're honoured to welcome him back to his homeland after he worked in the Netherlands for a while.

name: Fund the Ethical Policy
description: The Ethical policy was a splendid program, bringing welfare to the native population as is our duty as guardian of the Indian populace. Sadly it has been greatly underfunded since the conservatives implemented it. With the social democrats available in the Netherlands, we can turn that around!

name: Open More Schools
description: Better education means a better future. By opening more schools we can learn more natives how to read so they can take on more complicated task, which will in the future help both our economies and technological progress.

name: Werkverschaffing for Inlanders
description: The natives often fail to gain jobs just like the regular Dutch back home. By establishing werkverschaffing programs, we can lighten this burden.

name: Lift Bans on Nationalist Organisations
description: Previously, the Netherlands acted very frantically on the idea of allowing nationalist organisations, but we have to be honest with ourselves: we don't have the right to keep the Insulindians in chains forever, and if we help them and thus keep them happy, this will not be a detrimental move.

name: Universal Suffrage
description: The current system is fairly odd, only enfranchising a very small elite. We should allow everyone in the Indies to vote for the seats in the Volksraad. We can't get this through however without giving in to the demands that Dutch votes weight heavier.

name: Tjarda van Starkenborgh Stachouwer
description: Tjarda van Starkenborgh-Stachouwer has been a dutiful civil servant since a long time, and it seems no surprise that the homeland decided to appoint him as our new governor-general. Let us welcome him!

name: Limited Liberalisation
description: We should cut down a bit on the authoritarian nature of the colonial government. While it is true that we have to safeguard our presence here, pushing too hard will only have adverse effects.

name: Extra Funding for the Volksraad
description: The Volksraad is an important part of the colonial government, but severely underfunded. Even though it does not have a lot of power, it is essential in keeping policy in line with the interests of all groups in the Indies.

name: Strengthen the Volksraad
description: The Volksraad is currently merely an advisory body. There are sufficient safeguards keeping it in check, we can make it a bit more powerful, with more checks on the governor-general's office.

name: Congress of Batavia
description: It is time that we look into the future and recognize what is; in its current form the Dutch East Indies won't last forever, however, if we reform it can. We should negotiate with the local populace towards giving the Indies an equal status within the kingdom, and granting them citizenship.

name: Furstner
description: Admiral Furstner was an unexpected choice, having had few administrative jobs and being more a man of the navy. He was however a founding member of the VNH so perhaps it could've been expected...

name: Expand the PID
description: The Political Intelligence Service is the internal security service of the Indies. By expanding it we can more efficiently crack down on subversive movements in favour of 'independence'.

name: Expand Camps in Western New Guinea
description: The camps in New Guinea have always been ideal to store away dissidents. Being located in the middle of the New Guinea jungle, filled with hostile tribes, no one would even consider trying to escape. We should expand them to hold more dissidents.

name: Antinationalist Propaganda Campaign
description: Contrary to popular belief, not everyone supports this 'Insulindian Independence' idea. We can improve this situation by putting out propaganda, amongst other things about the state of such a nation should it break away.

name: Abandon the Ethical Policy
description: The Ethical Policy was a mistake, it only resulted in an educated elite who immediately showed that they were not ready, ranting against our rule. We should abolish it and make sure the Inlanders stay in the ricefields until they're actually ready for education.

name: Restore the Cultuurstelsel
description: During the Cultuurstelsel system, profits from the colony were higher than ever, until subversive books started to undermine it. Time to bring old times back!

name: East Indian Apartheid
description: Enforcing segregation may be frowned upon, but it is clearly the only way to avoid natives from poisoning the minds of Totoks and indo's with ideas that they should be equal.

name: Cultural Imperialism
description: We have been here for over 300 years yet still they remain clenched to their own backwards culture. We should change this by actually starting to promote superior Dutch culture.

name: Enforce Dutch Curricula
description: Despite our prolonged stay, Inlanders still tend to use Malay as lingua franca. It is unacceptable that such a language could fill that role, when Dutch is an alternative!

name: Eradicate Inlander Cultures
description: Especially in the east of the colonies, many small cultures exist. We should eradicate all traces of these, as they can't compete with Dutch culture on even a basic level.

name: Dissolve the Volksraad
description: The volksraad is a group of poor old sods who think they have the right to criticize the governor-general on everything he does. It is time we abolish this abomination once and for all and centre all power in the governor-general.
